intro: Chamaesyce clarkeana, commonly known as Clarke's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Chamaesyce clarkeana is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
